findings.title: M1: Unchecked return values for token transfers
findings.description: Unchecked return value for token transfers can lead to unexpected behavior and potential security risks.

findings.title: Division by Zero if Parameters are Not Set
findings.description: Potential division by zero error due to unset parameters.

findings.title: W1: Usage of `solc` optimizer
findings.description: Until the `solc` optimizer undergoes more stringent security analysis, opt-out using it.

findings.title: W2: Wide Solidity pragma usage
findings.description: The contracts are using a wide range of Solidity versions which can cause unexpected behavior if the version of the compiler used to compile the contracts is different from the one that was properly tested.

findings.title: W3: For cycle in the `payout` function can revert
findings.description: Calling the `payout` function can run out of gas if there will be a lot of iterations or at least be pricy on gas.

findings.title: I1: Inconsistent usage of `msg.sender` over `_msgSender`
findings.description: The protocol is using OpenZeppelin `Context` that defines `_msgSender` and `_msgData` functions, but uses `msg.sender` in some places. This inconsistency may lead to logic errors if the semantics are changed in the future.

findings.title: I2: The lockfile can be overwritten
findings.description: The `yarn` command can overwrite the lockfile leading to unexpected behavior due to different package versions.

findings.title: I3: Usage of hardcoded value instead of constant
findings.description: The `approve` function uses a hardcoded value instead of a constant in a calculation, causing worse readability and maintainability.

findings.title: I4: Unused function parameter
findings.description: The `deposit` function in the `PortfolioManager` contract has an unused parameter `_amount`. As a result, any address that is passed does not affect the function.

findings.title: I5: The `payout` function could be external
findings.description: The `payout` is public and could be external since it is going to be called only by an external service.
